alert.note: Alert for South End of the Lower Sierra; South End of the Upper Sierra (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 1:09AM PST until March 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 22 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...South End of the Lower Sierra and South End of the Upper Sierra mainly above 3000 feet including Sequoia National Park. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with the potential for prolonged road closures. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Whiteout conditions are possible at times. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: South End of the Lower Sierra; South End of the Upper Sierra
